intro: Sphacophyllum gossweileri, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the flowering plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the summer months. Sphacophyllum gossweileri is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
